summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2019 among federal prosecutors and FBI agents in the Southern District of New York, coordinating a meeting with potential witnesses (two sisters) and discussing serving a subpoena on publicist R. Couri Hay for information about Jeffrey Epstein's efforts to rehabilitate his image.

persons.name: BYRNE, PAUL
persons.context: Appears as a recipient on an email regarding the scheduling of a meeting and a new subpoena.

persons.name: R. Couri Hay
persons.context: Referenced as having had a conversation with Jeffrey Epstein about improving Epstein's reputation; prosecutors seek to contact him and serve a subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; discussed his prior conduct and efforts to rehabilitate his image with publicist R. Couri Hay.

connections.description: Hay was consulted by Epstein about strategies for improving Epstein's public reputation regarding his prior conduct.
Prosecutors, including Byrne as a recipient, are coordinating to serve Hay with a subpoena to obtain information about Epstein.

events.title: Discussion of subpoena for R. Couri Hay
events.description: Prosecutors discuss having someone serve a subpoena on publicist R. Couri Hay the following day, prompted by media reports of his conversations with Epstein.

events.title: Scheduling of meeting with sisters
events.description: Prosecutors and FBI agents coordinate a meeting for 6pm with two sisters who previously worked with Epstein and may have useful information or been victims.

events.title: Epstein's interview with Town & Country
events.description: Publicist R. Couri Hay gives an interview to Town & Country magazine where he discusses having talked strategy with Epstein for rehabbing his image.

keyFacts: Prosecutors sought to interview two sisters who previously worked with Jeffrey Epstein and may have been victims of coercive sexual encounters with Epstein and/or his associates.
Publicist R. Couri Hay was a target for a subpoena after giving media interviews about conversations with Epstein regarding strategies to improve Epstein's reputation.
Epstein told Hay that what he was convicted of did not constitute pedophilia, describing the girls as 'tweens and teens'.
The email chain shows active coordination in July 2019 between the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI agents on witness interviews and evidence gathering.
The document references FBI Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking in New York as being involved in the investigation.
